meanings.definition: The quality or state of being long or extended in duration.
meanings.sent1: The lengthiness of the movie made it difficult to sit through.
meanings.sent2: I was impressed by the lengthiness of the river flowing through the valley.
meanings.sent3: The lengthiness of the meeting was so extreme that even the clock seemed tired.
meanings.sent4: The lengthiness of the journey felt like a never-ending road stretching into the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The lengthiness of the winter nights made them seem endless and lonely.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being excessively long or verbose.
meanings.sent1: Her speech was filled with unnecessary lengthiness that bored the audience.
meanings.sent2: The lengthiness of the book made it a daunting task to finish reading.
meanings.sent3: The lengthiness of his explanation was so over-the-top that it became comical.
meanings.sent4: The lengthiness of the contract felt like wading through a swamp of words.
meanings.sent5: The lengthiness of the professor's lectures made students struggle to stay awake.
